function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Gender and trust in science correlate with compliance","Impact":"Risk of non-compliance among certain gender groups and people with low trust in science","Mitigation":"Promote education and awareness on COVID-19 mitigation measures for all genders and encourage trust in science through transparent communication","Technologies":"Educational campaigns, social media messaging, and community engagement initiatives","People":"Individuals who identify with certain gender groups and those who have low trust in science","Owner":"Health organizations, government agencies, and community leaders"},{"Description":"Perceived threat, moral alignment, and impulsivity correlate with compliance","Impact":"Risk of non-compliance among individuals who perceive lower threat, have conflicting moral beliefs, and are more impulsive","Mitigation":"Implement targeted interventions to increase awareness of COVID-19 threat, promote moral alignment with mitigation measures, and provide impulsivity management strategies","Technologies":"Behavioral intervention programs, cognitive-behavioral therapy, and moral messaging campaigns","People":"Individuals with lower threat perception, conflicting moral beliefs, and higher impulsivity","Owner":"Mental health professionals, community leaders, and public health advocates"},{"Description":"Descriptive social norms correlate with compliance","Impact":"Risk of non-compliance due to deviation from social norms","Mitigation":"Promote positive social norms around COVID-19 mitigation measures through community mobilization, peer influence, and role modeling","Technologies":"Social networking platforms, community engagement tools, and behavior change communication strategies","People":"Individuals influenced by social norms and community dynamics","Owner":"Community leaders, social influencers, and local authorities"}]}
